p: The analysis of the ethnobotanical data showed that central region was best suited to the medicinal plant and rangeland. Ethnobotanical use categories showed that leaves were commonly used parts for making indigenous recipes (28.08%), followed by fruits (19.76%) and seeds (15.6%) then roots (10.4%), flowers (9.36%) and aerial parts (4.16%). Then, the others parts of plant are rarely used ( Figure 2).
